intro: Anemone narcissiflora var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf crown imperial, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, nodding flowers that range in color from white to deep pink, resembling the blossoms of the narcissus flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often blooming in late spring to early summer. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens for its delicate, bell-shaped flowers.
